sage.renderer

Interface IRenderer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRenderer, JOGLActiveRenderer, JOGLRenderer

    public interface IRenderer
    The IRenderer interface defines the set of operations which all "renderers" must implement. It also defines enumerated types (constants) related to renderer control; these types should be used by classes wishing to define/control the operation of a specific renderer.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD
      RENDER_METHOD specifies the way in which an IRenderer should utilize the underlying hardware to draw objects.

    • Method Detail

      • addToRenderQueue

        void addToRenderQueue(SceneNode s)
        Adds the specified SceneNode to the rendering queue specified by the SceneNode.RENDER_MODE of the SceneNode.
        Parameters:
        s - - the SceneNode to be added to the rendering queue

      • processRenderQueue

        void processRenderQueue()
        Instructs the renderer to render (draw) the objects contained in its render queues.

      • clearRenderQueue

        void clearRenderQueue()
        Instructs the renderer to delete all objects from its render queues in preparation for a new rendering cycle.

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        Returns the ICamera object associated with this renderer
        Returns:
        the renderer's camera

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera camera)
        Sets the renderer's camera to the specified ICamera.

      • enableOrthoMode

        void enableOrthoMode(boolean enable)
        Controls whether the renderer is in orthographic or perspective mode. If ortho mode is enabled when processRenderQueue() is invoked, all SceneNodes in the render queue are drawn using orthographic projection. If ortho mode is disabled (the default) then SceneNodes are drawn using the perpective projection defined by the renderer's current ICamera settings (except that SceneNodes which have have had their SceneNode.RENDER_MODE explicitly set to SceneNode.RENDER_MODE.ORTHO are still rendered in orthographic mode).
        Parameters:
        enable - - enables orthographic projection rendering for all queued SceneNodes if true; otherwise, only SceneNodes with RENDER_MODE = ORTHO are rendered in orthographic form

      • isInOrthoMode

        boolean isInOrthoMode()
        Returns whether or not the renderer is currently in orthographic rendering mode.
        Returns:
        true if the renderer is in orthographic mode, else false

      • getCanvas

        java.awt.Canvas getCanvas()
        Returns the Canvas on which the renderer does its drawing
        Returns:
        the renderer's canvas

      • getRenderedPrimitiveCount

        int getRenderedPrimitiveCount()
        Returns the number of primitives which the renderer output during the most recent call to processRenderQueue().
        Returns:
        the number of rendered primitives

      • setRenderMethod

        void setRenderMethod(IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD renderMethod)
        Provides a hint to the renderer regarding the preferred rendering method on the underlying hardware. Note that since not all hardware nor all IRenderer implementations support all rendering methods, setting the renderer's IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD should be considered advisory.
        Parameters:
        renderMethod - - the preferred rendering method the renderer should use if the hardware supports it

      • getRenderMethod

        IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD getRenderMethod()
        Returns the renderer's current IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD setting.

      • createTexture

        com.jogamp.opengl.util.texture.Texture createTexture(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates an ITexture object utilizing the specified file. Note: the current specification for this Interface returns a JOGL-specific Texture object; this is planned to be changed at some point to instead return an object implementing the generic ITexture interface.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - the file containing the texture data
        Returns:
        a Texture object

      • getCurrentContext

        RenderContext getCurrentContext()
        Gets the RenderContext associated with the underlying IRenderer implementation.
        Returns:
        - the Renderer's current context

      • createRenderState

        RenderState createRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType type)
        Creates a RenderState object of the specified type. Each IRenderer implementation is responsible for implementing this factory method in an implementation-dependent way and such that it can return any of the RenderStates defined by RenderState.RenderStateType.

      • isRealized

        boolean isRealized()
        Returns true if the renderer is fully constructed and ready to be used. This method is necessary due to the multi-threaded nature of the interface between IRenderers and the underlying graphics system; successful return from an IRenderer implementation constructor does not necessarily insure that the underlying graphics system has completed the renderer construction. Applications constructing a renderer should invoke this method to determine whether the renderer is fully constructed ("realized") before using the renderer.
        Returns:
        true if the renderer implementation is ready for use

      • draw

        void draw(TriMesh trimesh)
        The renderer's implementation of drawing a TriMesh object. Every renderer must implement each of the draw() methods specified in the IRenderer interface.
        Parameters:
        trimesh - - the TriMesh to be drawn

      • getDefaultRenderState

        RenderState getDefaultRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType renderStateType)
        Returns the default RenderState for the specified RenderState.RenderStateType.
        Parameters:
        renderStateType - - the type for which the default RenderState object is being requested
        Returns:
        - the Renderer's default RenderState object for the specified type

      • swapBuffers

        void swapBuffers()
        Instructs this IRenderer to swap its front and back buffers, causing the content of the back buffer to be displayed. Note that some IRenderer implementations perform automatic buffer swapping at the completion of a call to processRenderQueue(); this method should not be invoked on such IRenderer implementations unless the implementation has first had auto-swapping turned off via a call to setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean) with false.

      • setAutoSwapEnabled

        void setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean onOff)
        Instructs the IRenderer implementation to enable or disable automatic back-buffer swapping at the completion of an processRenderQueue() invocation. IRenderer implementations may (but are not required to) implement automatic buffer swapping at the completion of processRenderQueue() when their autoswap enabled flag is true.
        Parameters:
        onOff - - the new value of the IRenderer's autoswap enabled flag
